instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01237: What is 820-01237? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-01779: What is 820-01779? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: iMac A2116 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01237</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a External display good, screen display none.
threads.message:
Hey guys.  I have a 2109 A2116 iMac which the customer upgraded the SSD on with a PCIe adapter.  Since the upgrade he got no display on the LCD but does get external display.

Initial Inspection we found the LCD cable to be damaged so we bought another, same issue, bought a new screen, same issue. Usual PRAM RESET stuff no change.

Taken the board out for inspection under the scope and can't find anything obvious, we've tried booting without the new SSD and adapter no change.

Can't find schematic/board view or any diode reading for the LCD connector.

Anyone have experience of this issue with maybe a different model that could point me in the right direction at all?

threads.title: iMac A2116 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01237</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a External display good, screen display none.
threads.message:

Check if <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01779</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (A2115 27") helps you.
